intro: Spiraea kinashii, commonly known as the Japanese spiraea, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pink flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and features arching stems with opposite, ovate leaves. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers well-drained soil. Spiraea kinashii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
